what: Coherent Forecast Combination for Linearly Constrained Multiple Time Series
title: Coherent Forecast Combination for Linearly Constrained Multiple Time Series
text: S’’ fosse foco, arderei ’l mondo (Sonetti, 86) Cecco Angiolieri, Italian poet. FoCo² (Coherent Forecast Combination) forecasting package designed handle multiple time series forecasts different experts, subject linear constraints. offers optimal heuristic methods combining expert forecasts reconciling multi-task approach. process either simultaneously (optimal case) sequentially (heuristic cases) integrates forecasts multiple experts incorporating priori constraints produce coherent forecasts. package designed manage different levels input complexity: example, experts might produce forecasts different subsets variables. Whether input consists forecasts variables expert (balanced case) partial (unbalanced case) forecasts subset variables, FoCo² efficiently organizes data applies combination reconciliation methods. also includes advanced tools handling forecast errors. package provides functions estimate forecast error covariance matrix, supporting simple, (block) diagonal (assuming uncorrelation) full covariance matrices.

title: FoCo2: Coherent Forecast Combination for Linearly Constrained Multiple Time Series — FoCo2-package
text: Methods tools designed improve forecast accuracy linearly constrained multiple time series, fulfilling linear/aggregation relationships linking components (Girolimetto Di Fonzo, 2024 doi:10.48550/arXiv.2412.03429 ). 'FoCo2' offers multi-task forecast combination reconciliation approaches leveraging input multiple forecasting models experts ensuring resulting forecasts satisfy specified linear constraints. addition, linear inequality constraints (e.g., non-negativity forecasts) can imposed, needed.

title: Cross-sectional optimal multi-task forecast combination — csmtc
code: set.seed(123) # (2 x 3) base forecasts matrix (simulated), expert 1 base1 <- matrix(rnorm(6, mean = c(20, 10, 10)), 2, byrow = TRUE) # (10 x 3) in-sample residuals matrix (simulated), expert 1 res1 <- t(matrix(rnorm(n = 30), nrow = 3))  # (2 x 3) base forecasts matrix (simulated), expert 2 base2 <- matrix(rnorm(6, mean = c(20, 10, 10)), 2, byrow = TRUE) # (10 x 3) in-sample residuals matrix (simulated), expert 2 res2 <- t(matrix(rnorm(n = 30), nrow = 3))  ## BALANCED PANEL OF FORECASTS # Base forecasts' and residuals' lists brc <- list(base1, base2) erc <- list(res1, res2)  # Aggregation matrix for Z = X + Y A <- t(c(1,1)) rrc <- csocc(base = brc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", res = erc)  yc <- csmtc(base = brc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", res = erc) M <- occmat(base = brc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", p = 2, res = erc)$M M%*%t(yc)-t(rrc) #> 3 x 2 Matrix of class "dgeMatrix" #>               h-1 h-2 #> [1,] 0.000000e+00   0 #> [2,] 1.776357e-15   0 #> [3,] 0.000000e+00   0  ## UNBALANCED PANEL OF FORECASTS base2[, 2] <- res2[, 2] <-  NA  # Base forecasts' and residuals' lists bgc <- list(base1, base2) egc <- list(res1, res2) matNA <- matrix(1, 3, 2) matNA[2,2] <- 0  # Aggregation matrix for Z = X + Y A <- t(c(1,1)) rgc <- csocc(base = bgc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", res = egc)  yc <- csmtc(base = bgc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", res = egc) M <- occmat(base = bgc, agg_mat = A, comb = "shr", p = 2, res = egc, matNA = matNA)$M M%*%t(yc)-t(rgc) #> 3 x 2 Matrix of class "dgeMatrix" #>               h-1 h-2 #> [1,] 0.000000e+00   0 #> [2,] 1.776357e-15   0 #> [3,] 0.000000e+00   0

what: Cross-sectional optimal coherent forecast combination — csocc
title: Cross-sectional optimal coherent forecast combination — csocc
text: function implements optimal linear coherent forecast combination linearly constrained (e.g., hierarchical/grouped) multiple time series combining forecasts multiple sources (experts). method minimizes forecast errors ensuring resulting forecasts coherent, meaning satisfy constraints across time series. Using linear constrained optimization approach, csocc combines forecasts multiple experts, accounting relations variables constraints. addition, linear inequality constraints (e.g. non-negative forecasts) can imposed, needed.

title: Matrices for the optimal coherent forecast combination — occmat
text: function computes matrices required optimal coherent forecast combination csocc, described Girolimetto Di Fonzo (2024). matrices serve foundation building forecasts effectively combines individual information multiple experts ensuring coherence across variables.

title: Matrices for the optimal coherent forecast combination — occmat
code: occmat(agg_mat, cons_mat, p = NULL, matNA = NULL,        comb = "ols", res = NULL, approach = "proj", ...)

title: Matrices for the optimal coherent forecast combination — occmat
text: agg_mat (\(n_u \times n_b\)) numeric matrix representing cross-sectional aggregation matrix, mapping \(n_b\) bottom-level (free) variables \(n_u\) upper (constrained) variables. cons_mat (\(n_u \times n\)) numeric matrix representing cross-sectional zero constraints: row represents constraint equation, column represents variable. matrix can full rank, meaning rows linearly independent, strict requirement, function allows redundancy constraints. p Total number experts, \(p\). matNA (\(n \times p\)) matrix consisting 0s 1s, element indicates whether expert \(j\) (column) provided forecast variable \(\) (row). expert \(j\) provided forecast variable \(\), corresponding element \((,j)\) 1; otherwise, 0. comb string specifying reconciliation method. details, see cscov. res list \(p\) numeric (\(N \times n\)) matrix containing -sample residuals. input used compute covariance matrices. approach string specifying approach used compute reconciled forecasts. Options include: "proj" (default): zero-constrained projection approach. "strc": structural approach. ... Arguments passed cscov.

title: Matrices for the optimal coherent forecast combination — occmat
text: list matrices: M Projection matrix. Omega Matrix combination weights optimal linear multi-task forecast combination. W Forecast error covariance matrix base forecasts. Wc Forecast error covariance matrix combined forecasts. Wtilde Forecast error covariance matrix reconciled combined forecasts. K Matrix replicates vector (see Girolimetto Di Fonzo, 2024).
